body: English only. And look like you changed the application.yml a lot, and remove many required modules.
@vanlin can you provide a demo to reproduce this issue?
thank you!

Why call the method twice?

cc @ascrutae We need to avoid this issue, but I just don't know why this happens.
@ascrutae Look like, runtime context should be stack based for each key? I am not sure yet.

Finally and sadly, we move in this way. Too many misguides because the Chinese document link.

@JaredTan95 Could send the finalization mail to dev ml, and also cc private ml. Tell all ones there, we are sorry to have to remove these documents and why.
hi @candyleer,  please look at this : https://github.com/vanlin/servicecombtest

> Why call the method twice?
> 
> cc @ascrutae We need to avoid this issue, but I just don't know why this happens.

Not one method twice, but one controller method with annotation RequestMapping calls another one with that annotation.
I think that is the exact case. You call between controllers.
This case is more common in some business environment, I will try to fix it in this version.
There are for different versions of protocol. We have upgraded the protocol, because of concept changed. One for v5 protocol, the other for v6 protocl, started at 6.0.0-beta release.

@hanahmily Following test result comes from real Envoy, case provided by @dio 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/53942071-d3bbaa00-40f4-11e9-9c79-1bf4f11f7646.png)

This is the docker-compose file, I am using. But it only works in my private env
```yaml
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
# distributed with this work for additional information
# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

version: '3.3'
services:
  elasticsearch:
    image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:6.3.2
    container_name: elasticsearch
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 9200:9200
      - 9300:9300
    environment:
      discovery.type: single-node
  oap:
    image: skywalking/oap
    container_name: oap
    depends_on:
      - elasticsearch
    links:
      - elasticsearch
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 11800:11800
      - 12800:12800
    volumes:
      - ./config:/skywalking/config:ro
  ui:
    image: skywalking/ui
    container_name: ui
    depends_on:
      - oap
    links:
      - oap
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      collector.ribbon.listOfServers: oap:12800
  envoy:
    image: envoyproxy/envoy-alpine:latest
    command: /usr/local/bin/envoy -c /etc/envoy.yaml --service-cluster envoy-proxy
    depends_on:
      - oap
    ports:
    - "10000:10000"
    - "9901:9901"
    volumes:
    - ./envoy.yaml:/etc/envoy.yaml
```

The envoy image is from here. https://github.com/dio/metricsink
Do you plan to send this server setting optional or required one?

First of all, how codes run based on how they write. Tracing agent has no magic, just show you the code path. If it says, it invoke twice, it most likely invokes twice. 

And your debug confirm that, what is your question? We can't tell why all codes wrote in this way.
Welcome to be the 99th contributor.
Done!
I make the Coverage back. I don't know why the old setting is not working anymore. Anway.

> First of all, how codes run based on how they write. Tracing agent has no magic, just show you the code path. If it says, it invoke twice, it most likely invokes twice.
> 
> And your debug confirm that, what is your question? We can't tell why all codes wrote in this way.

the run method of HttpClientRibbonCommand is called once, but the beforeMethod of HystrixCommandRunInterceptor is called twice.  
Maybe I don't express clearly, sorry.
That is mutiple instrumented, means there are instrument definitions, which match this single one class.

The task is a good start for those who are new to SkyWalking and are interested in translating (like me :), but it may take a long time to finish and need patience, do you prefer contributor to open a single PR after translating the whole documents or one PR per some files step by step @wu-sheng
Optional, just for advanced user.

@kezhenxu94 Yes, we used to have part document, which misguide users to read. They think, SkyWalking don't have full and well provided documents, but we have, just in English. 

So 2 days ago, that part of document has been removed #2315 . If you want to contribute in that part, I prefer we host it somewhere else, such as here, https://github.com/SkyAPM . If you want to help, I could create a repo and invite you as a collaborator.

### Current configuration
#### Turn on
* receiver-register
* receiver-trace
* receiver-jvm
* service-mesh
* istio-telemetry
#### Turn off
* receiver_zipkin

I didn't find any rules or principles. Let me make a suggestion:
Turn on: The receive data is from our agent.
Turn off: The receive data if from other util or system.
@wu-sheng I'd like to work on this, and study SkyWalking further by this chance, but again, the translation work might take some time, thanks

I am thinking of something else than the principle. 

I think we can't say `turn on` agent only is the right call, because, in our document, we call ourself observability analysis platform and have capabilities to process and visualize multiple formats. We started the project by javaagent, doesn't mean it must be agent working, especially we have other languages. As far as I known, @liuhaoyang will provide .NET CLR receiver soon, maybe in 6.1.0

But we can say one thing, we could run in multiple scenarios
1. Language agent.
1. Service Mesh.
1. Envoy.
1. Zipkin

In these three modes, we have certain receivers and `application.yml`, right? Could we consider to deliver different startup scripts to run in different modes?
- `startup-in-language-agent-mode.sh`, Trace, JVM, CLR, register on.
- `startup-in-mesh-mode.sh`, istio, mesh, envoy, register on.
- `startup-in-proxy-mode.sh`, only envoy on.
- `startup-in-zipkin.sh`,  zipkin and trace on.

And, with
- `startup-all.sh` with all receivers on(only turn zipkin-off, because it is not production ready, this is a clear principle). This is for quick-start and docker entry.

If we have this, we could have a clear document why we open these receiver, and which scenario requests us to open.
@kezhenxu94 Invite you to https://github.com/SkyAPM/document-cn-translation-of-skywalking
If you want to publish it as GitHub Pages page, let me known.

@yeerpeng @wu-sheng 
1. From the previous pressure measurement, the record insertion and deletion are the key issues. There is no need to change the metrics. Why IndicatorEsDAO has been changed. 
2. There is no need to add a new method named historyOther in IHistoryDeleteDAO, the parameters in deleteHistory method are enough to delete the index by the time.
3. No found the implementation of the other DBs.
4. Just for record, Why are other queries affected?  getClient().search(new String[]{EndpointInventory.MODEL_NAME}, searchSourceBuilder)
5. queryTrace by trace id is really needs the UI to be modified or we can try to search from the records indexes. Not too more, and the trace id is primary key. So I think the performance loss is acceptable.

> Codes make sense to me. Just one suggestion, share should be sharing. Share in your meaning is verb., the better choice is SharingServer or just simple ReceiverServer

Agree.

> queryTrace by trace id is really needs the UI to be modified or we can try to search from the records indexes. Not too more, and the trace id is primary key. So I think the performance loss is acceptable.

This is hard to say. Which do you expect UI knows? Or which field should we add into GraphQL protocol?

> I prefer to each MySQL plugin has its instrumentation file. just like this
I saw some interceptors classes are duplicate, and I suggest that those the class should move to the project jdbc-common.

I want to argue for these. 

First, these are MySQL interceptor, not JDBC's. Don't move those into the jdbc-common.
Then, if you want to reuse, and separate them in different plugin folders and instrument, then create a new mysql-commom module, and v5, v6, v8 for each version.
Also, I already saw instrument's package names are different,and include version. @ascrutae could you make yourself clear?

~~If you are saying the duplicate interceptor codes(I don't read all codes) and separate plugin versions, then, I think these are right calls~~
~~1. Create mysql-common module for duplicate codes~~
~~2. Create 5, 6, 8 mysql plugin modules, and place the right instrument declarations in there.~~

~~@dsc6636926 Any concern for this change?~~

~~@ascrutae make sense?~~

> I prefer to each MySQL plugin has its instrumentation file. Just like this.

Because I saw that every instrumentation file in `mysql-5.x-plugin` have implements `witnessClasses` method, and I smell some bad code smells. So I suggest that each plugin has its instrumentation file, e.g., `Mysql5Instrumentation`. It implements `witnessClasses` method and all instrumentation file extend this class.

>I saw some interceptors classes are duplicate, and I suggest that those the class should move to the project jdbc-common.

My main proposal is that move the duplicate code into one place. I think your suggestion is better than mine, please follow your way. :-)
We are welcome the contribution. Right now, I don't know any one is working on this.
okay，i will think about the suggestion，and i will make it support jdk6
Appreciate, and let's merge this pr soon.

This change should be easy, I want to know,  do you think, does `GET/` and `POST/` make more sense? Because I think the basic issue is how to make get/post difference. If YES, then I will support to make this as default, rather than using `Config.Agent.FORCE_FULLY_QUALIFIED_ENDPOINT_NAMES` setting.

> You will end up with more endpoints in SkyWalking

This is fine, I think. Millions of endpoints are supported in production env.

We are using the class name in some RPC frameworks, such as gRPC, Dubbo, etc. `Config.Agent.FORCE_FULLY_QUALIFIED_ENDPOINT_NAMES` looks like should be named as `Config.Plugin.SpringMVC.USE_CLASSNAME_AS_ENDPOINT_NAME`(so something like this)

@wu-sheng, thanks for the quick response. I do just want to tell the difference between the `GET` and `POST`. Having the request method type in the operation name would probably have been sufficient but I'm not sure if that's the only scenario that exists that could create a situation like this. I can implement both if you want but I primarily would like the qualified name as the endpoint. As you say, other services use the qualified name as the endpoint and that's what I've been using for those.

I completely missed the `Config.Plugin` section. That's a better place for this configuration, agreed. I'm thinking the name of `Config.Plugin.SpringMVC.USE_QUALIFIED_NAME_AS_ENDPOINT_NAME`. These are small changes so I'll see what you think about adding the request method in the endpoint name before opening a pull request.

If the qualified name stays in optional, I am totally OK, also the GET/POST should be in operation name to ease some similar cases like yours.

> I'm thinking the name of Config.Plugin.SpringMVC.USE_QUALIFIED_NAME_AS_ENDPOINT_NAME

I think the name is fine, just please add this to agent document and have a clear description about what it is for.

Also, in the PR, please notice, you should provide a pr in https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases too. Add new test scenario about `spring-with-qualified-op-name`, set the `USE_QUALIFIED_NAME_AS_ENDPOINT_NAME` to true through `-D` script. Also, You don't need all versions to recheck, just one or two should be enough.

@wu-sheng, would you mind taking a look at https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/issues/54?

Also, when you say to create a new test scenario I'm guessing you mean another of those top-level folders? Like https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/spring-scenario but instead https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/spring-with-qualified-op-name? I'm also a bit confused on which script I would be placing the `-D` option on. Do you have an example you could show?

Yes. Another top level folder. For -D, I mean, the default setting of qualifiedname as endpoint is false, right? You need a way to open it in testing. SkyWalking could do settings in agent.conf and -D override through command argument. 

@ascrutae Is the agent.conf could be set in test repo? If Yes, please provide the way, thankd.

@BFergerson Just follow [this documents](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/blob/master/docs/how-to-write-a-plugin-testcase.md#run-test-cases) and please ping me if you have any question about how to run test cases.

> The HttpClient sends the GET request by calling HttpClientRequestImpl.end(). I take the ContextCarrier and inject it into the header and open the ExitSpan. I also assign the ContextSnapshot to the request (via EnhancedInstance) for closing later.

You should finish the span, and hold the ContextSnapshot. When callbacke happens, create a new local span(should be new context, because other closed their exit span too), and continue the ContextSnapshot.

> I pull the ContextSnapshot from the response (via EnhancedInstance) and close the EntrySpan once HttpServerResponseImpl.end() is called as this signifies the response has been written.

From you description, I am a little confused about how you use `ContextSnapshot` and `ContextCarrier`. How does `I pull the ContextSnapshot from the response` happen? The ContextCarrier is designed for across processes(RPC, MQ), ContextSnapshot is used across thread in a single process only. Is this just typo or do I miss somthing?

> I pull the ContextSnapshot from the request (via EnhancedInstance) and close the ExitSpan once HttpClientRequestImpl.doHandleResponse() is called as this signifies a request has been replied to.

In pure async scenario, like vertx, response is just a new local span, entry span should be closed as soon as an async jos assignment happens. Don't wait until this reponse called. Because if the thread model you provided, the thread could do anything because another thread to process the logic and do the response.

> It's once //vertx.setPeriodic(1000, v -> callGetProduct()); is uncommented that it starts acting up. As you can see, setPeriodic makes the call to callGetProduct every second. This means that I won't have the previous trace closed by the time the next one starts.

I think my prev explanation about when is the right time to close span, should make this easier. Create snapshot and finish the ongoing span when do `setPeriodic`, then create a local span when `v -> callGetProduct` happens.

------
I think my most answers focus on one thing, `close/finish span` before async job happens. :) Hope this would help you.

This produces the diagram:
![Screenshot from 2019-03-11 22-12-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3278877/54174367-c03d7580-444b-11e9-8883-36e056ce5b25.png)

Which is sort of odd when it considers the same trace as:
![Screenshot from 2019-03-11 22-19-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3278877/54174411-ed8a2380-444b-11e9-95c4-ba0cc33c598b.png)

It seems to somewhat understand that it took 4 seconds to complete.
Essentially I followed your advice and made the process as such:
 - When the `GET` request is called the `ExitSpan` is opened on `beforeMethod` and the `ContextCarrier` is added to the header. The `ContextSnapshot` is saved to the `SkyWalkingDynamicField` for the request. The `ExitSpan` is closed on `afterMethod`.
 - The `GET` call is received and a `EntrySpan` is opened with the `ContextCarrier` extracted from the request's headers during `beforeMethod`. The `ContextSnapshot` is set on the `SkyWalkingDynamicField` of the response object.  The `EntrySpan` is closed on the `afterMethod`.
 - 4 seconds pass
 - `HttpServerResponseImplEndInterceptor.beforeMethod` is triggered and creates a `LocalSpan` and calls `ContextManager.continued` with the `ContextSnapshot` saved to the response object. The `LocalSpan` is closed on the `afterMethod`.
 - `HttpClientRequestImplDoHandleResponseInterceptor.beforeMethod` is triggered and creates a `LocalSpan` and calls `ContextManager.continued` with the `ContextSnapshot` saved to the request object. The `LocalSpan` is closed on the `afterMethod`.

I don't exactly have a question here so I hope you see what I'm doing wrong. The code I'm testing with is located here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/compare/master...BFergerson:master
You reset the elasticsearch, so agent must reboot too.

I've reproduced this bug on a Windows machine, below is the minimal yet runnable demo:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/54176899-7ac08d00-44cb-11e9-8477-65149db5a815.png)

note the output:

```
resource.getFile() = D:\abc%20def\test\target\classes\org\sample\Test2.class
resource.getFile() = D:\abc def\test\target\classes\org\sample\Test2.class
```

the result of `resource.getFile()` is encoded (`%20` for spaces), and using `new File(resource.toURI())` works well, I'll send a PR to resolve this.
